item.title: Gas canister left on pavement., 7th July
item.description:
A gas canister and cabinet has been fly tipped on the pavement opposite no 62 Tyler Street near to the gate entrance to 71 Tyler Street which l believe is sheltered housing. A potential hazard especially as in full view of the sun.

item.title: Overflowing rubbish bins, 7th July
item.description:
The recycling and general waste bins outside Finn House are always overflowing. People are piling rubbish beside them instead and it doesnâ€™t seem to get collected - it sits there for days to weeks at a time. It smells awful and is brining furry friends ðŸ˜¬

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bevenden Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Large amount of debris littering Blackwall tunnel approach, 7th July
item.description:
I regularly drive on the A102 from the Sun in Sands roundabout to Blackwall tunnel and have noticed a vast amount of litter and general debris on that road. I expected it to have been cleared once the roadworks for the new Silvertown tunnel had been removed but it is still there. When is this road going to be cleaned?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Tunnel Approach, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lemmon Road, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Metal gates left leaning against the block and car hubcap left in the shared garden, 7th July
item.description:
Could you please remove thise metal gates that are leaning against the block asap? These are not secured and can collapse one of the children playing in the garden. Please get rid of the car hubcap let on the grass too. Thank you!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London

item.title: Bus stop On Salusbury Road, 7th July
item.description:
Since removing the bin And Also cutting down the tree at this bus stop it is constantly used as a bin site, and or tipping site. Every single say people leave their rubbish on top of the tree stump. And leave their cigarette butts on the floor around the tree trunk. It's encouraging more rats and pigeons. Its a busy bus stop used by a number of schools / families. It's a disgrace that the bin has been removed when it's clearly needed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park playing area., 7th July
item.description:
I am writing to formally express my serious concerns regarding the ongoing neglect of the childrenâ€™s play area. Despite a previous complaint I submitted last week, it is clear that little to no action has been taken. A minimal and inadequate clean was conducted if at all! leaving the core issues unresolved. The current state of the area is unacceptable and dangerous! Litter is strewn across the site, including broken glass, which poses a serious hazard to children. Overgrown bushes are encroaching on equipment, making the space feel unsafe and uncared for. There is a clear lack of routine maintenance, leaving equipment dirty broken and unsafe for use. I urge you to treat this matter with the seriousness it deserves. I strongly recommend an immediate site visit to fully understand the condition of the area. If appropriate action is not taken promptly, I will have no choice but to escalate this issue to our local MP. I look forward to your swift response and a timeline for resolution.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kimberley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of overhanging vegetation needs cutting back, 7th July
item.description:
This extends from the corner of William Booth Road all the way up towards Crystal Palace well over 100m. Includes brambles, roses and pyracantha - which are all thorny. Difficult to see any of it at night due to the street lighting being restricted. This road is also used by people with visual impairments.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drugs, mattress, bin bags, broken bushes, 7th July
item.description:
People are flytipping Mattress and other large rubbish, loads of tree / bush waste aswell. the whole car park needs a clean as you can see loads of drug canisters and rubish all around the edges of the car park and around the fences
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bell Street, Charlton, London
